Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure, wearing a Corinthian helmet (Athena?), following the 'Tanagra style'. The woman has her hair organised with a central parting (?) under the helmet. From a two-piece mould, with some remodelling with a sharp tool. Head only, would have been joined to a complete figure. Light red-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XV, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.371) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4557 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
